org.wikiutils

Class GUIUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wikiutils.GUIUtils

  • public class GUIUtils
extends Object
    Contains several GUI methods that could be useful for editing applications
    Author:
    Fastily
    See Also:
    CollectionUtils, DateUtils, IOUtils, LoginUtils, ParseUtils, StringUtils, WikiUtils

    • Method Detail

      • showStackTrace

        public static void showStackTrace(Throwable e)
        Shows a JOptionPane with the stacktrace/backtrace for the Throwable passed in. Useful in GUI applications.
        Parameters:
        e - The Throwable object to print a stack trace for

      • buildForm

        public static JPanel buildForm(String title,
                               JComponent... cl)
        Creates a form in the form of a JPanel. Fields are dynamically resized when the window size is modified by the user.
        Parameters:
        title - Title to use in the border. Specify null if you don't want one. Specify empty string if you want just border.
        cl - The list of containers to work with. Elements should be in the order, e.g. JLabel1, JTextField1, JLabel 2, JTextField2, etc.
        Returns:
        A JPanel with a SpringLayout in a form.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - If cl.length == 0 || cl.length % 2 == 1

      • directoryFetch

        public static File[] directoryFetch(File starting)
        Creates a JFileChooser that allows user to select multiple directories. Program is exited if user cancels/closes the dialog box.
        Parameters:
        starting - Starting directory. If you want to use the user's home directory, I suggest using System.getProperty("user.home")
        Returns:
        A list of Files representing directories the user selected.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the solitary param is non-existent or not a directory.

      • makeLabel

        public static JLabel makeLabel(String s)
        Returns a trailing JLabel with specified String.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to make into a label.
        Returns:
        The JLabel.
